parameters: \pop[2]Dante immediately closes the door after Isaac leaves.
\pop[2]But not only that. He locks it too. Perhaps Isaac should've considered that.
\pop[2]Well, at least we have privacy for whatever he wanted to talk about, now.
\pop[2]He takes determined steps forward, and grabs the bottle of whiskey.
\pop[2]One large swig later, he turns to face me, with a look of sorrow in his eyes.
\pop[3]Isaac's mod gave my phone some high-level access.
I looked into my family, Delta. I really did it.
\pop[2]He takes a step back, like he regrets raising his voice.
It's just - I wish I didn't do it.
\pop[3]Has that ever happened to you, Delta?
Sought out information, only for it to hurt you?
\i[3]"Of course. Sometimes, we even know it'll hurt beforehand."
\i[3]"Yeah. That's part of why I moved away from home."
\i[3]"Of course. Sometimes, we even know it'll hurt beforehand."
I kinda thought it might hurt.
But it's also better than not knowing.
\pop[3]I mean, otherwise, I'd always wonder "what if".
And that's basically the same thing as regret.
\i[3]"Yeah. That's part of why I moved away from home."
I guess sometimes, you have no choice but to run away.
Part of me wishes I could. But I \c[14]need\c[0] to stay and face the facts.
\pop[3]I had to make a snap decision in that server room, Delta.
And I knew that it was probably the only chance I'd get.
\pop[3]I was put on the spot in the \c[14]worst\c[0] possible way.
At least, I \c[14]think\c[0] it was the worst.
\pop[3]But at least now I don't have to live with a "what-if".
In \c[14]my\c[0] books, that's the exact same thing as regret.
\pop[3]Ironic that I'm full of regret either way, huh?
\pop[3]Regretful of the knowledge I'd regret not knowing...
There's \c[14]gotta\c[0] be something poetic about that.
\pop[2]I shrug. I'm just curious what he found out.
\pop[2]He places the whiskey back down, but I can tell he was tempted to have more.
\pop[3]Well, I didn't even know where to start.
I figured I'd just look them up, and find an address.
\pop[2]There's a long pause before he continues.
\pop[2]He almost breaks down in front of me, as his eyes glisten.
\pop[2]I know he's holding back, but I can hear the sheer sorrow in his voice.
\pop[3]The last entry in their file was some kind of incident report.
It mentioned something about a gas leak in the house.
\pop[3]It was only a few years after I ran away.
I don't know how to feel. I'm just so confused...
\pop[2]He's shaking. I simply step forward and wrap my arms around him.
\pop[3]My brother seems so \c[14]proud\c[0] when he looks at me.
Like everything is fine, and I'm worth looking up to.
\pop[3]And the hate between me and my parents is long gone.
This vision is what I've based all my decisions around...
\pop[2]I continue holding him, and just let him vent.
\pop[3]If I knew this was gonna happen, I would've stayed!
I would've fixed things, and spent more time with them!
\i[3]"But then you wouldn't be who you are today."
\i[3]"But then you wouldn't be who you are today."
I know you're right, and it sucks.
\pop[3]I like that version of me in the vision, though.
I feel so complete. Like, I can tell I'm missing something in reality.
\i[3]"You have a family in all of us, Dante."
\i[3]"You have a family in all of us, Dante."
\pop[2]I can tell he's starting to calm down.
\pop[3]And if I stayed, I guess I wouldn't be here right now.
But maybe they wouldn't have had another kid.
He didn't deserve what happened to him...
\pop[3]I think that's the part that hurts the most, Delta.
I really would've liked to meet him.
\pop[3]Everyone is out there celebrating victory, and a new tomorrow.
But the tomorrow I've discovered leaves me feeling hollow.
\i[3]"You should be thankful for your vision, Dante."
\i[3]"You should be thankful for your vision, Dante."
\i[3]"Remember what we talked about on the way to the club?"
\i[3]"Remember what we talked about on the way to the club?"
\i[3]"You'll get to spend time with your family almost every day."
\i[3]"You'll get to spend time with your family almost every day."
\pop[2]He sniffles some more, but I can tell the tears have subsided.
\pop[3]You know, I usually pride myself on my level head.
This just really shook me up, you know?
\pop[2]He wraps his arms around me, and hugs me back.
\i[3]"They'll comfort you. Every day, until your last."
\i[3]"They'll comfort you. Every day, until your last."
\pop[3]I have a feeling you will, too...
\pop[3]The same could be said about you and the others.
We're in this together. Until the end, right?
\pop[2]He shakes his head, like he's shrugging off the sadness.
\pop[2]A moment later, our tight embrace is broken.
It just wasn't easy, learning what I did.
\i[3]"I don't blame you. Grief can consume us."
\i[3]"I don't blame you. Grief can consume us."
\pop[2]He rubs the back of his head.
\pop[3]You know, I guess my vision was a good one after all.
Not many people get to spend time with lost loved ones...
\pop[3]I'm looking forward to the next time it happens, now.
I can just picture their smiles. The taste of the food.
It's a perfect moment. Frozen in time for us to enjoy.
\pop[3]And \c[14]nobody\c[0] can take that away from me.
Our love as a family prevails, even over \c[10]death\c[0].
Isn't that the most beautiful thing you ever heard?
\pop[2]I nod. Enjoying the reversal of his mood.
\pop[2]Sometimes, all it takes is a little... creative thinking.
\pop[2]He's clearly still grieving, but this new train of thought will help him.
\pop[2]He gulps, as he looks in my eyes with the slightest hint of shyness.
\pop[3]Remember how I wanted to start seizing the moment?
\pop[3]There's this scene in one of my books.
Two lovers, in a cabin, just like this one.
\pop[3]It's where they share their first kiss.
I just. I thought it'd be cool if-
\pop[2]He cuts himself off, while stumbling on his words.
\pop[3]I mean, I think it's the perfect place for...
\pop[2]I cut off his words by going in for a kiss.
\pop[2]He lets out a soft moan, and raises one of his hands to my face.
\pop[2]Softly stroking my cheek, he presses himself more into the kiss.
\pop[2]It lasts for what feels like forever, but then Dante slowly pulls back.
\pop[3]You know, I had a whole speech rehearsed...
\i[3]"It seemed like you needed some help."
\i[3]"It seemed like you needed some help."
\pop[3]Good to know we're on the same wavelength, though.
I knew you'd be special since the day I met you.
\pop[3]Though it's hard to believe we only met a few weeks ago.
So much has happened, it's hard to comprehend.
\i[3]"And so much has yet to happen, too."
\i[3]"And so much has yet to happen, too."
\pop[3]Yeah. And for me, my \c[17]Komorebi\c[0] will no longer dictate how I feel.
It's odd how something named after the light could leave us feeling so lost in the dark.
\pop[3]But even in the darkness, you can always find light.
I guess you just have to know where to look.
\pop[2]As he speaks those words, he looks right into my eyes.
\pop[3]I guess that's all I wanted to talk about...
But I \c[14]knew\c[0] you were the right person to confide in.
You continue your flawless record of never letting me down.
\pop[3]Except for that day we first met.
Don't think I'll forget that you sided with Isaac.
I guess you're just lucky that \c[14]I\c[0] stand with him now, too.
\pop[2]I nod, as he heads toward the locked door.
\pop[2]As soon as he opens it, the frigid air rushes into the cabin.
I think we're just waiting for Isaac to make a decision.
But... I know that guy better than almost anyone else.
\pop[3]And I just want you to know that we're gonna be fine.
Isaac is gonna \c[14]burn\c[0] that drive to keep us all safe.
If he doesn't? I might just put up a fight about it~
\pop[2]With a smile, he leaves the building
\pop[2]I follow suit soon after, and close the door behind me.
\pop[2]It shuts with a loud banging noise, that echoes through the night.
